column4: Hello, I was wondering if anyone could help me with figuring out a screen resolution problem
if it's simple
if you could put 3 things up on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org : /etc/X11/xorg.conf , /var/log/Xorg.0.log , and the output of  lspci | grep -i vga
I have no idea where you got that xorg.conf from. That's definitely not an ubuntu generated one :)
what I would do is sudo dpkg-reconfigure -pcritical xserver-xorg , make sure that was giving me my correct res first
buh... it was at 1280x768.... O_o
first things first, get a simple xorg , build from it
okay, how would I go about that?
with that   sudo dpkg-reconfigure -pcritical xserver-xorg
Oh, okay. Did that.
ok, now log out and back in, so X will restart and use the new xorg.conf
okay, thanks, brb
okay. Back.
what's your res?
is that what you want?
I think so :) Before I could only get up to 1280x800 :)
if the res is good, now   sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf  , and look for the line  Driver "nv" , change that to nvidia and log out and back in
Okay, logging out, thanks brb
okay, back. Things are definatly sharper. Smaller, but sharper :)
good, you should be able to enable compiz, system->prefs->appearance , last tab
yeah, got compiz going now
